intro: Notholaena brownii, commonly known as the Brown's spikemoss, is a species of moss in the family Huperoniaceae. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and dark green to reddish-brown foliage. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sporophytes, which are typically small and clustered at the tips of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or rocky crevices. Notholaena brownii is a rare and specialized plant, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
